DataElement.preferredName: Peritumoral Tissue Sample Collection Less Initial Pathologic Diagnosis Date Calculation Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time interval from the date of the initial pathologic diagnosis to the date of peritumoral sample collection, represented as a calculated number of days.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Peritumoral Tissue Sample Collection Subtraction First Pathologic Diagnosis Time Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Located in tissues surrounding a tumor._A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._The act of removing a part from the whole._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Peritumoral Tissue Sample Collection Subtraction First Pathologic Diagnosis Time
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Located in tissues surrounding a tumor.:A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:The act of removing a part from the whole.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: Located in tissues surrounding a tumor.
A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
The act of removing a part from the whole.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The period of time during which something continues.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for LUAD Sample Submission form per request by K.Wildermuth. mc 12/15/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Calculation created for TCGA content requested by Dr. Ari Kahn.  This VD uses a calculation of dividing a value by the number of milliseconds in a day (86,400,000) to result in a number of days, stored as a whole number.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Number of days from Date of I
ReferenceDocuments.description: Number of days from Date of Initial Pathologic Diagnosis to the Date of Peritumoral Sample Procurement
